625:3=   a) how many times can 3 fit into 6? 2 times, write down 2. subtract 6 from 6, 0 is left.     625:3=2  - 6 -----   0   b) bring 2 down. how many times can 3 fit into 2? it cant, write down 0. subtract 0 if you want to.     625:3=20 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     2   c) bring down 5. how many times can 3 fit into 25? 8 times to get 24. write down 8, subtract 24.     625:3=208 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     25 -   24 --------       1   d) now that there is no more numbers to bring down we put a comma or a decimal point or whatever you prefer after 208 and start bringing down 0s which are decimal 0s. 3 goes into 10 3 times, write down 3.     625:3=208.33 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     25 -   24 --------       10 -       9 -----------           10  -           9 -------------              1   obviously in this case it is never ending so stop whenever you want lol  8991:37=   a) how many times does 37 go into 8? it doesnt, we look at 89. how many times does 37 go into 89? 2 times. write down 2, divide by 74 (37x2).    8991:37=2 -74 ------  15   b) bring 9 down, how many times does 37 go into 159? 4 times. write down 4, divide by 148.    8991:37=24 -74 ------  159 -148 ------    11   c) bring down 1, how many times does 37 go into 111? 3 times. write down 3, subtract 111.    8991:37=243 -74 ------  159 -148 -----    111 -  111 ---------        0   lets do one more with a finite number of decimals xd   246:8=   a) how many times does 8 go into 2? it doesnt. how many times does 8 go into 24? 3 times. write down 3, subtract 24.     246:8=3 - 24 -----     0   b) bring down 6. how many times does 8 go into 6? it doesnt, write down 0, subtract 0. (you can also just bring the next number down)     246:8=30 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       6   c) because there is no more numbers to bring down, write a coma after 30 and bring down an imaginary 0. how many times does 8 go into 60? 7 times. write down 7, subtract 56.     246:8=30.7 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       60     - 56 ----------         4   d) now bring down another imaginary 0. how many times does 8 go into 40? 5 times. write down 5, subtract 40.     246:8=30.75 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       60     - 56 ----------         40       - 40 ------------           0

625:3=   a) how many times can 3 fit into 6? 2 times, write down 2. subtract 6 from 6, 0 is left.     625:3=2  - 6 -----   0   b) bring 2 down. how many times can 3 fit into 2? it cant, write down 0. subtract 0 if you want to.     625:3=20 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     2   c) bring down 5. how many times can 3 fit into 25? 8 times to get 24. write down 8, subtract 24.     625:3=208 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     25 -   24 --------       1   d) now that there is no more numbers to bring down we put a coma or a decimal point or whatever you prefer after 208 and start bringing down 0s which are decimal 0s. 3 goes into 10 3 times, write down 3.     625:3=208.33 - 6 -----   02 -   0 -------     25 -   24 --------       10 -       9 -----------           10  -           9 -------------              1   obviously in this case it is never ending so stop whenever you want lol 8991:37=   a) how many times does 37 go into 8? it doesnt, we look at 89. how many times does 37 go into 89? 2 times. write down 2, divide by 74 (37x2).   8991:37=2 -74 ------ 15   b) bring 9 down, how many times does 37 go into 159? 4 times. write down 4, divide by 148.   8991:37=24 -74 ------ 159 -148 ------    11   c) bring down 1, how many times does 37 go into 111? 3 times. write down 3, subtract 111.   8991:37=243 -74 ------ 159 -148 -----    111 -  111 ---------        0   lets do one more with a finite number of decimals xd   246:8=   a) how many times does 8 go into 2? it doesnt. how many times does 8 go into 24? 3 times. write down 3, subtract 24.     246:8=3 - 24 -----     0   b) bring down 6. how many times does 8 go into 6? it doesnt, write down 0, subtract 0. (you can also just bring the next number down)     246:8=30 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       6   c) because there is no more numbers to bring down, write a coma after 30 and bring down an imaginary 0. how many times does 8 go into 60? 7 times. write down 7, subtract 56.     246:8=30.7 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       60     - 56 ----------         4   d) now bring down another imaginary 0. how many times does 8 go into 40? 5 times. write down 5, subtract 40.     246:8=30.75 - 24 -----     06       0 --------       60     - 56 ----------         40       - 40 ------------           0
